Scilab function

NAME

    show_arcs - highlights a set of arcs

CALLING SEQUENCE

show_arcs(p,[sup])

PARAMETERS

    • p : row vector of arc numbers (directed graph) or edge numbers (undirected graph)
    • sup : string, superposition flag

DESCRIPTION

    show_arcs highlights the set of arcs p of the displayed graph in the current window. If the optional argument sup is equal to the string "sup" , the highlighting is superposed on the previous one.

    This function can also be called to unhighlight highlighted arcs by using the call show_arcs([]) . Note also that when a set of arcs is highlighted, the automatic highlight during mouse move is not performed. Calling show_arcs([]) restores the automatic highlight during mouse move.

EXAMPLES

    g=load_graph(SCI+"/demos/metanet/mesh100.graph");
t=min_weight_tree(1,g); 
show_graph(g,0,[500,500],[500,500]);
// hilite the tree t 
show_arcs(t);
// unhilite 
show_arcs([]);
